intro: Plectronia myriantha, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Plectronia myriantha thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas or near streams.
